title: U.S. Seeks Extradition of Former Honduras President on Drug-Related Charges
sub_head: U.S. prosecutors allege that Juan Orlando Hernández took bribes to protect drug traffickers who shipped tons of cocaine to the U.S.
body:
MEXICO CITY—The U.S. government has requested the extradition of former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández on drug-related charges just weeks after he left office, a senior Honduran official said Tuesday.
U.S. prosecutors allege that Mr. Hernández, who left office in January, received millions of dollars in bribes from drug smugglers who shipped tons of cocaine to the U.S. in exchange for protection by Honduras’s government. He has denied any involvement in drug trafficking or corruption. Mr. Hernández’s brother Juan Antonio was found guilty of drug trafficking in New York and is now serving a life sentence in prison.
